options: Identification of the target audience, its needs and desires
Creation of a unique selling proposition
Development of sketches, concept and main ideas of the website

Framework development. At this stage, the designer schematically develops the framework of the elements of the future site and approves it with the customer. It takes from 5 to 20 days to develop the frame, depending on the complexity of the project.

Prototype. After approval of the framework, ideas and general principles, the final user interface is created. A UI/UX designer "paints" the site for developers, lays out all the elements, and shows visually what the final product will look like.

2.explanation: Front-End development is the technical creation of a website. Developers bring the designer's ideas to life and make the drawn buttons, fields and blocks clickable, active and responsive. In essence, this is the technical creation of the site interface. Your visitors interact with it.

options: Setting up non-standard data processing (for example, playing audio or video)

4.explanation: The content on the site offers users not only valuable and useful information, but also positively affects the optimization of the site. Keywords are written in the articles, thanks to which search engines analyze the text and determine the page's place in the output.

5.explanation: SMM is aimed at selling goods and services in social networks. Even if you think that in your niche it is difficult or unnecessary to promote anything on social networks, you need to do this type of marketing. SMM increases brand awareness, builds relationships with clients and potential buyers.

6.explanation: A domain name is an individual website address by which your customers and visitors will find you on the Internet.

0.explanation: As a rule, this is a small resource for brand promotion. In essence, this is a business card site that presents the company, its services or products. As a rule, such a site includes the pages "About the company", "Reviews", "Services and services", "Contacts", "Blog". The price depends on the number of pages and the time spent on their creation

1.explanation: A landing page can be of two types: a separate one-page site to promote a single product or service, or a separate page on an existing site. The task of the landing page is to provide users with the necessary information about the product or service without distracting other elements.

2.explanation: This subtype of site is usually a compact online storefront designed to present information about a company, product, or service. Unlike more complex sites, such as online stores or portals, business card sites usually consist of several pages that contain basic information about the business.

3.type: A blog for companies, organizations, influencers
3.explanation: A blog is considered one of the easiest types of development. At first it seems that its functionality is primitive. But if you understand the tools, it is easy to understand that a blog needs a quality text editor, tools for working with visuals and other functions that affect the cost of the project

4.explanation: A corporate image site differs from other types of sites in that it is focused on creating a comprehensive image of the company, its values ​​and brand. It usually offers a ton of reference blocks, sophisticated design, functionality and integration, as well as an emphasis on communicating with the target audience and strengthening the company's image

0.name: UI/UX design
0.description: Craft seamless and visually appealing user interfaces (UI) and ensure a smooth user experience (UX) to captivate your audience.

1.name: Front-end development
1.description: Bring your designs to life with expert front-end development, creating responsive and interactive web applications.

3.name: Copywriting
3.description: Elevate your content with captivating copywriting that engages your audience and delivers your brand's message effectively.

4.name: SMM
4.description: Boost your online presence and connect with your audience through strategic social media marketing campaigns, driving engagement and growth.
